unnormalised: Mumbai: The State Bank of India (SBI) announced revised interest rates on personal loans, impacting lakhs of borrowers across the country. The change, effective 15/07/2024, sees a marginal increase of 0.25% across all loan brackets, citing rising operational costs and market fluctuations as primary drivers.
normalised: Mumbai: The State Bank of India (S-B-I) announced revised interest rates on personal loans, impacting lakhs of borrowers across the country. The change, effective fifteenth July two thousand and twenty four, sees a marginal increase of zero point two five percent across all loan brackets, citing rising operational costs and market fluctuations as primary drivers.

unnormalised: Previously, SBI offered personal loans starting from 10.5% p.a. Now, the lowest rate available is 10.75% p.a. A senior bank official, Mr. Rajesh Kumar, stated that while the increase is minimal, borrowers with existing EMIs of Rs. 10,000 could see a rise of approximately Rs. 250-300 per month.
normalised: Previously, S-B-I offered personal loans starting from ten point five percent p.a. Now, the lowest rate available is ten point seven five percent p.a. A senior bank official, Mister Rajesh Kumar, stated that while the increase is minimal, borrowers with existing E-M-Is of rupees ten thousand could see a rise of approximately rupees two hundred and fifty to three hundred per month.

unnormalised: This announcement has sparked mixed reactions. Financial analyst Ms. Priya Sharma commented, "While the increase is small, it could affect household budgets, especially for those already struggling with inflation." She advised borrowers to explore options like prepaying small amounts to reduce their overall interest burden. Several customers took to social media expressing concerns over the added financial strain. "Another hike! How will we manage?" lamented one Twitter user, echoing the sentiments of many.
